headline: ConocoPhillips (COP) Price Target Lowered by $6
summary: ConocoPhillips (NYSE:COP) is included among the 10 High Yield Crude Oil Stocks to Buy After Trump’s Blitz in Venezuela. headline: Oil Is Surging Over $60: Grab These Large Cap High-Yield Dividend Energy Giants Now
summary: Oil prices fell well below $60 per barrel recently before rallying back above that key level this week, initially driven lower by oversupply and weak demand. Global oil inventories had been rising, putting downward pressure on prices. At the same time, both OPEC+ and U.S. production were increasing amid relatively stable global oil demand, as ... headline: Trump Presses US Oil Giants To Pour $100 Billion Into Venezuela As Greenland Ambitions Rise
summary: On Friday, President Donald Trump urged U.S. oil industry leaders to commit $100 billion to rebuild Venezuela's shattered petroleum sector following the removal of Nicolás Maduro. Trump Makes Oil Investment Pitch As Venezuela Awaits Rebuild At a White House gathering with executives from Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM), Chevron (NYSE:CVX), ConocoPhillips (NYSE:COP), and other energy firms, Trump said Venezuela needs a dramatic overhaul. headline: What You Need to Know for January 13, 2026
summary: 1. headline: Oil Hits 7-Week High. Trump Tariffs Threat Sparks Concern Over Iran Supply.
summary: Oil hit its highest level since November after President Donald Trump said he would impose a 25% tariff on goods from countries “doing business” with Iran, in the wake of deadly protests in the Islamic Republic.  Brent crude futures  are trading at $64.19 a barrel, after jumping more than 3.9% over the previous five sessions.  Elsewhere,  West Texas Intermediate  is up slightly at $59.81.

headline: Why Oil Majors Are Hesitant to Invest in Post-Maduro Venezuela
summary: Major U.S. oil and oilfield service companies are hesitant to re-enter Venezuela’s oil sector, despite the regime change, citing significant concerns over commercial frameworks, legal stability, and past asset seizures.

raw.headline: Why Oil Majors Are Hesitant to Invest in Post-Maduro Venezuela
